availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Samuel Nimrod Marshall (Shelby County, Kentucky, physician)

body.p: Shelby County, Kentucky, physician. Kentucky native. Son of Samuel and Druzilla Marshall. Married to Drucilla Carpenter Marshall in Shelby County on May 18, 1855. Father of May D. Marshall, William Marshall, and Thomas T. Marshall. Physician in Shelby County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Spencer County, District 2, pg. 112A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Shelby County, District 1, p 160.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Shelby County Marriages, Roll #000259291 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "S.N. Marshall (1830-1898)," Memorial # 31355284, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/31355284 (accessed April 7, 2018).
